value.title: Innocent pregnant woman jailed amid faulty facial recognition trend
value.excerpt: Woodruff's arrest, and the recent trend of false arrests, has sparked a new round in an ongoing debate about the reliability of facial recognition technology in criminal investigations. Critics say the trend highlights the weaknesses of facial recognition technology and the risks it poses to innocent people.

value.title: Detroit Woman Sues City Police After Being Wrongfully Arrested Due To AI Facial Recognition
value.excerpt: Six police officers arrested Porcha Woodruff, who was eight months pregnant, after mistaking her for someone who had robbed a car.

value.title: Ryanair challenged by Noyb over ‘invasive’ facial recognition

value.title: Facial recognition system implemented at Incheon Airport
value.excerpt: Incheon Airport said it has begun utilizing preregistered facial information to streamline the departure process for passengers from Friday. Dubbed the "facial recognition smart pass service," the newly launched service will allow passengers to quickly pass through the identification process at departure and boarding gates without having to show their passports and boarding passes to security personnel.

value.title: Ryanair Accused Of 'Invasive' Facial Recognition Use
value.excerpt: A prominent digital privacy campaign group on Thursday filed a complaint against Ryanair in Spain, alleging the popular budget carrier was pushing customers to undergo an "invasive facial recognition process".

value.title: Privacy group challenges Ryanair's use of facial recognition
value.excerpt: Digital rights group NOYB on Thursday filed a complaint against Ryanair , alleging that it is violating customers' rights to data protection by using facial recognition to verify their identity when booking through online travel agents.
